title: Bristol History Podcast: Centuries of slavery and the city, and how enslaved people helped abolish the trade | The Bristol Cable
description: Bristol's long involvement in trading enslaved human beings, and the overlooked history of how it was brought down.

title: Frustrated and ignored: Meet people excluded from Covid-19 financial support | The Bristol Cable
description: Three million UK taxpayers have had no access to the government’s Covid-19 support packages. Excluded Bristolians say they have been left struggling and feeling angry.

title: Watch: The struggle for the future of Britain's best street | The Bristol Cable
description: A furore has kicked off over proposals to pedestrianise one of Bristol's most iconic streets, St Marks Road, with famous shop Sweetmart threatening to leave! Easton native Neil Maggs investigates whats going on behind the headlines.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Sam Williamson, head teacher on education in one of the UK's most deprived areas | The Bristol Cable
description: Children's futures almost stolen, inequality made worse by algorithm and education in the time of COVID-19 in some of the UK's most deprived neighbourhoods.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Krazy, the local hip-hop heavyweight who punched a racist | The Bristol Cable
description: As a white man he has been accused of cultural appropriation, despite growing up in the scene.

title: Thread by @NeilMaggs2: I watched with interest @DavidOlusoga & his speech on the media last night. Some facts. The UK population is around 13% BAME, and on scr…
description: Thread by @NeilMaggs2: I watched with interest @DavidOlusoga & his speech on the media last night. Some facts. The UK population is arounE, and on screen TV BAME talent is at 23%, so nationally is infact over represented. BUT... Offscreen talent ie p…

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Krazy, the local hip-hop heavyweight who punched a racist | The Bristol Cable
description: As a white man he has been accused of cultural appropriation, despite growing up in the scene.

title: 'Why we must challenge media narratives of Travellers' | The Bristol Cable
description: A Cable member recently cancelled their membership because we write about inequalities faced by Gypsies, Roma and Travellers instead of where the latest unauthorised encampment is. Here’s why we do that.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with David Goldblatt, on how sport can help save us from climate change | The Bristol Cable
description: Football clubs are gonna need gondolas to get supporters to pitches and sports fans are untapped climate change champions, says the leading voice on sport and society.

title: WATCH: Confinement Stories - a snapshot of life in lockdown Bristol | The Bristol Cable
description: As restrictions ease and life returns slowly to ‘normal,’ this film captures human stories showing a snapshot of what life in lockdown Bristol was like. The Cable teamed up with local filmmakers Paula Romero and Jacobo Garcia to produce this moving audio-visual time capsule.

title: Community protests against horrific racist hit-and-run, 'attempted murder' in Bristol | The Bristol Cable
description: The horrific hit-and-run against a 21-year old NHS worker in Horfield shook the city. The Cable spoke to one Horfield local and protesters campaigning against racism.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Jimmy Galvin, the artist who hadn't read a book at 20 | The Bristol Cable
description: Growing up in poverty on north Bristol council estate Lawrence Weston, Jimmy didn’t read a book until he was 20. His life changed when his girlfriend took him to the Tate gallery in London.

title: Bristol activists spearhead the call for reparations for the legacy and current damage of slavery and colonialism | The Bristol Cable
description: As Green councillor Cleo Lake petitions Bristol’s mayor, Marvin Rees, to lobby the UK government about reparations, we explore what that means, and talk to the Bristol activists involved.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Marti Burgess, the first Black Merchant Venturer | The Bristol Cable
description: Marti is the first Black person to join the Merchant Venturers, the 500 year old club of slave trader Edward Colston

title: Bristol History Podcast: The Bristol Bus Boycott | The Bristol Cable
description: This week I met with Professor Madge Dresser to discuss the Bristol Bus Boycott of 1963. The boycott against the Bristol Omnibus Company over its racist employment policy was the first black-led protest against racial discrimination in post-war Britain. We explored race relations in Bristol around the time of the boycott, and why its legacy continues to resonate so strongly today.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Delroy Hibbert | The Bristol Cable
description: Delroy Hibbert is a Black Lives Matter backer. But he also attended the ‘All Lives Matter’ demonstration in Bristol the week after Colston fell.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Cleo Lake | The Bristol Cable
description: Founding member of Countering Colston, Green party city councillor and former Lord Mayor, Cleo Lake has a lot to say on the big questions of politics, race, history and the future of Bristol and beyond.

title: Listen: Bristol Unpacked with Neil Maggs | The Bristol Cable
description: Bristol Unpacked with Neil Maggs brings you fascinating and challenging conversations from characters of all stripes on big topics facing the city and beyond. Sign up to the Cable’s newsletter and follow us on social media to listen in. Subscribe for new episodes on Spotify and Apple Podcasts. Presenter: Neil Maggs Audio producer: Rosa Eaton Executive producer: Adam Cantwell-Corn Illustration: Jazz Thompson

title: Call for Rovers, City and Bears fans to unite in tribute to fallen fans
description: Renowned boxing trainer Chris Sanigar has lost two close friends to COVID-19, and he wants Bristolians to pay tribute all of the city's sports fans who have died with the virus

title: 'A true gent' - Tributes flood in for legend of Bristol grassroots sport
description: "He was revered by all, not only for his footballing contribution but also for the man he was"

title: 'We should have achieved more' - Saunders on love and regret for Rovers
description: The Gas legend discusses the glory days, what went wrong after Gerry Francis, contentious chants and his own disappointing exit

title: 'Covid-19 is creating a housing crisis in Bristol' - A lettings agent on how to avert it | The Bristol Cable
description: Tenants don’t need to be lumped with rent arrears and landlords can still get their rent in the long run, writes Bristol lettings agent Boris Drappier

title: 'Career-defining moment' - Rickie Lambert on Rovers, Liverpool, England and more
description: The Bristol Rovers icon discusses his Gas highlights, greatest teammates and his rise from League Two to the World Cup

title: 'I was a non-league player at heart' - Gary Penrice's Bristol Rovers story
description: From Mangotsfield to Aston Villa and QPR in the Premier League, the former Gas striker details his career highlights
